title: How to Make Marshmallow Desserts

steps.headline: Melt the chocolate.
steps.description: To make a chocolate sauce for the marshmallow kebabs you must first obtain a source of chocolate such as a chocolate bar, chocolate chips or chocolate melts. Place the chocolate in a microwave-safe bowl, set the microwave setting to lowest heat and microwave for 30 seconds. The chocolate chips must be microwaved for 10 seconds otherwise they will burn. After the chocolate has cooked, mix it and leave it to cool.

steps.headline: Put your strawberries and marshmallows on the kebab in a pattern.
steps.description: Do this when the chocolate sauce has cooled so that it isn't hot. Place the kebabs on a plate.

steps.headline: Drizzle chocolate onto the kebabs.
steps.description: When the chocolate sauce is cooled you may drizzle it onto the marshmallow kebabs or dip the kebabs in the sauce and serve.

steps.headline: Put a mini marshmallow on top of a toothpick.
steps.description: Afterwards, stick one big marshmallow onto the bottom of the toothpick and keep pushing the marshmallow until it reaches the mini marshmallow.

steps.headline: Add a toothpick to the sides of the big marshmallow.
steps.description: These will be the hands of the mini marsham.

steps.headline: Draw a face on the marshmallow.
steps.description: Use a food pen/marker to draw eyes, a nose, mouth, eyebrows, etc. Now you have your mini marsham! Never use a ordinary marker, you must use a food marker.

steps.headline: Bake a chocolate cake.
steps.description: Once baked, cut the cake into mini circles and stack three marshmallows onto the cake. Use icing as a glue. The circles shouldn't be too small, just enough to fit three marshmallows on top.

steps.headline: Melt your compound chocolate.
steps.description: Using the same melting method as marshmallow kebabs, melt the chocolate in a microwave for 30 seconds. The microwave should also be at the lowest heat otherwise the chocolate will burn.

steps.headline: Spread the chocolate into circles on parchment paper.
steps.description: Let the chocolate set and become hard. You could also place the chocolate into the fridge to set for about an hour or two.

steps.headline: Cut a small hole in the middle of your cake.
steps.description: After, put the hardened compound chocolate underneath the cake and melt your regular chocolate using the microwave method.

steps.headline: Leave the regular melted chocolate to cool.
steps.description: Once cooled pour it into the centre of the cake where you made the hole and add some mini marshmallows.

steps.headline: Cover the top of the cake with another chocolate circle.
steps.description: Place the cake on a plate if not already on one and scoop some ice cream on the side. You can also drizzle melted chocolate over the cake and serve.

steps.headline: Put your marshmallows in a bowl.
steps.description: The bowl should be microwave safe. For another method roast the marshmallows on top or beside a fire.

steps.headline: Put the marshmallows in the microwave for a minute.
steps.description: Make sure to stop the marshmallows every few seconds to make sure they aren't getting burnt. You should also mix the marshmallows every time you check on them otherwise they will burn and stick at the bottom of the bowl.

steps.headline: Take the marshmallows out.
steps.description: Once golden brown, take the marshmallows out and serve.

text: Marshmallow Strawberry Kebab Melt the chocolate. To make a chocolate sauce for the marshmallow kebabs you must first obtain a source of chocolate such as a chocolate bar, chocolate chips or chocolate melts. Place the chocolate in a microwave-safe bowl, set the microwave setting to lowest heat and microwave for 30 seconds. The chocolate chips must be microwaved for 10 seconds otherwise they will burn. After the chocolate has cooked, mix it and leave it to cool. Put your strawberries and marshmallows on the kebab in a pattern. Do this when the chocolate sauce has cooled so that it isn't hot. Place the kebabs on a plate. Drizzle chocolate onto the kebabs. When the chocolate sauce is cooled you may drizzle it onto the marshmallow kebabs or dip the kebabs in the sauce and serve. Mini Marshams Put a mini marshmallow on top of a toothpick. Afterwards, stick one big marshmallow onto the bottom of the toothpick and keep pushing the marshmallow until it reaches the mini marshmallow. Add a toothpick to the sides of the big marshmallow. These will be the hands of the mini marsham. Draw a face on the marshmallow. Use a food pen/marker to draw eyes, a nose, mouth, eyebrows, etc. Now you have your mini marsham! Never use a ordinary marker, you must use a food marker. Chocolate Marshmallow Lava Cake. Bake a chocolate cake. Once baked, cut the cake into mini circles and stack three marshmallows onto the cake. Use icing as a glue. The circles shouldn't be too small, just enough to fit three marshmallows on top. Melt your compound chocolate. Using the same melting method as marshmallow kebabs, melt the chocolate in a microwave for 30 seconds. The microwave should also be at the lowest heat otherwise the chocolate will burn. Spread the chocolate into circles on parchment paper. Let the chocolate set and become hard. You could also place the chocolate into the fridge to set for about an hour or two. Cut a small hole in the middle of your cake. After, put the hardened compound chocolate underneath the cake and melt your regular chocolate using the microwave method. Leave the regular melted chocolate to cool. Once cooled pour it into the centre of the cake where you made the hole and add some mini marshmallows. Cover the top of the cake with another chocolate circle. Place the cake on a plate if not already on one and scoop some ice cream on the side. You can also drizzle melted chocolate over the cake and serve. Roasted Marshmallows Put your marshmallows in a bowl. The bowl should be microwave safe. For another method roast the marshmallows on top or beside a fire. Put the marshmallows in the microwave for a minute. Make sure to stop the marshmallows every few seconds to make sure they aren't getting burnt. You should also mix the marshmallows every time you check on them otherwise they will burn and stick at the bottom of the bowl. Take the marshmallows out. Once golden brown, take the marshmallows out and serve.
